name: Game Set and Match 2
description:
Game Set and Match 2 is a compilation of re-issued sports games, featuring several different sports. It is the sequel to Ocean's earlier compilation, Game Set and Match.

The games in this compilation are:
  • Super Bowl (Not available in the Amstrad CPC version)
  • Winter Olympiad 88 (Not available in the Amstrad CPC version)
    The game in this compilation does not support a joy-stick.
  • Basket Master
  • Ian Botham's Test Match
  • Super Hang-On
  • Match Day II
  • Nick Faldo Plays the Open
  • Championship Sprint
  • Steve Davis Snooker
  • Track and Field
The game Track and Field is a port of an arcade game developed by Konami in 1984. Details of the original game and the platforms it was ported to can be found here.
The port to the ZX Spectrum included in this release was not sold individually and was only issued within this compilation.
The game is for one or two players and can be played with either a keyboard or a joystick. There are six mini-games , the 100m dash, long jump, the hurdles, the javelin, the hammer and the high jump. Each with four degrees of difficulty easy, normal, difficult and awesome.

The games can be played individually or as a tournament where the player(s) must meet a qualifying time / distance in order to progress to the next sport.

shot.caption: Track & Field load screen. Follow the links to for each individual game to see screen shots of the other games in this compilation.
Game setup screen. Player 1 must be a human player. Player 2 can be human, (using joystick 1 or 2) or the computer
100m dash. This is a simple game based on hitting the Z and X keys alternately to build up and maintain speed.
100m Dash. Both competitors have just crossed the line. Speed is shown in centimeters per second.
Long Jump : Speed is built up by hitting the Z & X buttons, as in the dash. At the end of the run up the player hits and holds the SPACE key until a suitable angle of leap is reached
If the jump starts too soon or too late then the player gets a foul. This second jump was close to the record for this level
Long jump : the character looks good in the air
Javelin : The same game-play as the long jump. Build up speed on the run up then hold the space bar until the right angle of release is achieved. Here the javelin has just been released
javelin : there's a little animation showing the javelin fly through the air and land
Hurdles : Again the player hammers the Z & X keys for speed and hits the SPACE key to make the jump. Aly hurdle hit slows the player down. The computer seems to make all its jumps.
Hammer : The Z & X keys are used to increase the rate of spin and the space key is used to release the hammer. As with previous games it's vital to hold the space key to get a good angle of release
Hammer : Three good throws, the earlier shorter throws were at really low angles
High jump : the computer controls the run up. The player has to press and hold SPACE at the right time to make the jump
